solution: First, simplify the left side using the exponent rule $x^{-1} = \frac{1}{x}$. We have \[\frac{5^{-1}}{25^{-1}} - b^{-1} = \frac{1/5}{1/25} - \frac{1}{b} = \frac{1}{5} \cdot \frac{25}{1} - \frac{1}{b} = 5 - \frac{1}{b},\] so we can rewrite the original equation as $5 - \frac{1}{b} = 2$. Subtracting 5 from both sides gives $-\frac{1}{b} = -3$, and taking the reciprocal of both sides gives $-b = -\frac{1}{3}$. Therefore, we have $b = \boxed{\frac{1}{3}}$.
